title: Candlelight vigils and a looming protest: 3 years on, Ankita Bhandari murder case continues to put heat on Uttarakhand govt
First oral pill for anaemia in thalassaemia patients approved by US FDA: Why is this a milestone therapy?
In Telangana, illicit business behind an ordinary facade
description: From a school building in Bowenpally to a chemical unit in Cherlapalli, narcotics operations functioned undisturbed for months and years in different parts of Hyderabad, shielded by familiarity and public trust. This strategy of hiding in plain sight, according to investigators, blunts suspicion, delays intelligence gathering and allows criminal economies to expand quietly. Naveen Kumar delves into the networks, methods and audacity of these hidden hubs

description: In Haryana, folk music has given way to Haryanvi pop over the past decade, marking a generational shift and taking the local music industry to international platforms. Part of this trend are themes of guns, gangs, and hooliganism, with many such songs garnering millions of views, leading to police complaints and ban orders by courts, finds Ashok Kumar

description: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has shattered box office records, becoming the highest-grossing Hindi film ever with a monumental Rs 1,136.75 crore worldwide. The spy thriller achieved a historic Rs 100 crore in its fourth week, outperforming new releases and setting new benchmarks for Bollywood. Its unprecedented run continues to dominate screens.

How Animal Aid Association in Madras became Blue Cross of India
description:
In 1959, Captain V. Sundaram brought home two stranded puppies he found on a flooded street near his house at T. Nagar.
He built makeshift kennels at home for injured and abandoned animals. This organisation was registered as the BCI in 1964

title: An idol found near Gangaikonda  Cholapuram confirms the ‘Thiruvarasu’ of Nathamunigal
description: Near the Gangaikonda Cholapuram-Kumbakonam Road is a place called Sorgapallam or Sembodai where an idol of Srinivasa  Perumal  as once found half-buried under a tree. In the year 2000, another idol was found buried in a field. It was that of the first of the Sri Vaishnava Acharyas, who was said to have been at the place in his final hours

title: Tamil Nadu’s link to a key amendment to the Constitution on freedom of press, expression
description: On March 1, 1950, the Madras government banned Cross Roads, a Left-leaning journal. A month later, the Supreme Court’s full Bench, by five to one, quashed the order. The Constitution had to be amended in the light of the landmark judgment. Parliament adopted the amendment Bill, with 246 members voting in favour and 14 against

Govt proposes 90-day work a year for gig workers to get social security
description: Gig and platform workers must be engaged for at least 90 days with an aggregator in a financial year to qualify for social security benefits under the new Social Security Code. This threshold increases to 120 days for workers engaged with multiple aggregators. The rules also outline registration requirements and the formation of a National Social Security Board.

title: Hindu businessman attacked, set on fire in Bangladesh
description: Das, who runs a medicine shop and mobile banking business, was travelling in an autorickshaw when the attackers intercepted the vehicle and allegedly beat him up, hacked him with sharp weapons

title: Beautiful Thiruvellarai
'This is how greatness is built': Pathan backs Gill to follow Kohli's path
description: Irfan Pathan drew parallels between his own early international career under Rahul Dravid and Shubman Gill's current trajectory. Pathan believes Gill's leadership roles have fostered significant growth, mirroring the lessons he received about handling increased pressure. Despite a T20 setback, Pathan sees Gill's talent and willingness to learn as indicators of future success.

title: Hatchery for Olive Ridley nesting set up at Besant Nagar beach
description: The facility in Besant Nagar beach is fully operational. Plans are also on to set up hatcheries in Neelankarai, Kovalam, and Pulicat; more of these will come up this nesting season, if required

title: Vehicle registrations rose by 8.4% in 2025 in Tamil Nadu
description: More than 40% of the total registrations were concentrated in Chennai, Chengalpattu, Tiruvallur, Coimbatore, Madurai, and Salem districts; a total of 21.18 lakh vehicles were registered last year

description: The New Year’s Day release follows the government’s announcement that it released 99 people on December 26, which would bring a total of 187 people released in two ​weeks

Aravalli-like row in Bengaluru: SC panel to visit on Friday
description: A Supreme Court panel will inspect Bannerghatta National Park following a plea against a government decision to drastically shrink its eco-sensitive zone. Activists argue the move, reducing the zone from 268.9 sq km to 168.8 sq km, benefits mining and real estate interests, potentially harming wildlife and Bengaluru's green cover.

title: WTT Youth Contender: 334 players from 10 countries, Feeder Series in Vadodara
description: The second edition of the WTT Youth Contender, featuring U-11 to U-19 categories, will be held from January 2 to 5, followed by the WTT Feeder Series from January 7 to 11

title: Bengal SIR: EC warns of action if voters aged 85 and above called for hearings
description: Strict action awaits Booth Level Officers (BLOs) and their supervisors if elderly, sick, or disabled voters are summoned for hearings. Despite prior instructions, reports indicate these vulnerable individuals, including pregnant women, were still asked to appear. The Election Commission now mandates home verification for such electors, aiming to prevent distress and uphold its image.

title: YSRCP questions ‘secrecy’ over Naidu’s foreign tour
State records 5.78% growth in net GST collections in December 2025
description: At ₹2,652 crore, the collections are the highest-ever for the month of December since the GST regime began in 2017, says official

'Sincaraz' set to dominate as 2026 tennis season kicks off
description: Alcaraz and Sinner, or “Sincaraz” as they have been dubbed, play an exhibition in South Korea on January 10 in their only warm-up before the Australian Open eight days later

title: Approached HC 104 times to hold rallies in West Bengal: BJP leader
description: Suvendu Adhikari said that interventions by the Calcutta High Court were necessary because the police routinely denied permission ‘purely to stifle opposition voices and crush democratic rights’

title: First time in its history, Bangladesh to try postal ballots in 2026 election
description: According to the Election Commission of Bangladesh, more than 1.2 million Bangladeshi citizens – both living at home and abroad – have registered already to cast votes through postal ballot system

title: No participation fee, financial responsibility by AIFF among conditions from clubs for ISL restart
description: Putting conditions on their participation in the ISL, the clubs also requested the national federation to furnish "a clear, time-bound roadmap for execution of the long-term plan

title: RTI: Four of 10 faculty posts vacant across 11 AIIMS
description: Nearly 40% of sanctioned faculty posts remain vacant across 11 AIIMS, revealing a significant staffing crunch at India's premier public hospitals. This widespread shortage, affecting both older and newer institutes, raises concerns about patient care, specialist services, and medical education amidst rising patient loads.

title: ED searches seven locations in Rajasthan in Digi Mudra scam case
description: The ED initiated investigation based on the first information reports registered by the Special Task Force, Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, and other police stations in various districts of Rajasthan, Haryana, Odisha and Maharashtra

title: NMC orders hospitals to stock rabies drugs after Supreme Court flags stray threat
description: Medical colleges nationwide must now maintain constant stocks of anti-rabies vaccines and immunoglobulin, following Supreme Court directives. This crucial step ensures timely treatment for dog-bite victims, addressing rising incidents in public spaces. The National Medical Commission's order mandates uninterrupted availability, bolstering public health safety measures across institutions.

title: Odisha bureaucracy asked to work on 15-point agenda to move the State up in development ladder
description: Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi emphasised on efficient and corruption-free administration.

title: ED attaches ₹33.66-crore assets in Birla Emporium-Ira Finance case
description: The ED probe is based on a First Information Report registered by the police in Manipur,  against Yumnam Irabanta Singh, director of Birla Emporium and Ira Finance

description: Opposition blames government and police for the situation; Trinamool says police taking necessary action

description: “Genuine users were released after detailed device analysis with a strict warning to refrain from VPN usage in the future,” the police said

title: Rajnath Singh to unveil Vajpayee’s portrait at Assembly on January 3
Indore water contamination: Deathly silence in Bhagirathpura; toll rises to nine
description: A contaminated water supply in Indore's Bhagirathpura has led to a severe diarrhoea outbreak, claiming nine lives and hospitalizing over 200 residents. A leaking toilet waste pit near a water line is blamed for the contamination. Families are grappling with loss and illness, with one teacher losing her six-month-old son.

title: Arunachal celebrates India’s first sunrise of 2026 with ‘Dance of the Dawn’
description: The performance was an artistic narrative through chants, songs, and indigenous rhythms of the Meyor and Mishmi communities, combined with contemporary dance and poetry

description: Mamdani inherits a city on the upswing, after years of slow recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic

title: Oppose land distribution to workers, lose incentives: Assam CM to tea planters
description: The State government brought legislation to guarantee “land protection” for 3.33 lakh tea plantation worker families across 825 estates

title: Tom Brady and Alix Earle spark dating rumors after cozy NYE video goes viral
description: Viral clips from a New Year's Eve party in St. Barths show Tom Brady and Alix Earle in close conversation and dancing. Earle recently ended a relationship, fueling speculation about a potential romance with the NFL star. While fans are buzzing, neither has confirmed a relationship, leaving it as a viral holiday moment.

title: India, Bangladesh begin talks on Ganges treaty
description: India and Bangladesh have commenced discussions to renew the Ganges Water Sharing Treaty, which expires in December 2026. Both nations have begun joint water level measurements of the Ganga and Padma rivers, with data to be collected bi-weekly until May 31. This initiative involves teams from both countries and highlights the importance of the ongoing negotiations.

title: Delhi recorded cleanest air in eight years in 2025: Environment Minister Sirsa
description: According to an official statement, Delhi recorded around 200 days in 2025 when the air quality index (AQI) remained below 200, marking an improvement of about 15% compared with the previous four years

title: 'Act by Jan 26': Canada asks Air India for action against 'tipsy' pilot
description: Air India faces scrutiny from Transport Canada after a pilot was found intoxicated before operating a flight from Vancouver on December 23, 2025. Canadian authorities reported the pilot failed a breathalyser test, leading to his removal from duty. Air India is investigating and has informed the DGCA, with potential enforcement action expected.

NMC clears 171 additional PG seats for 2025-26 academic year
description: Medical aspirants will benefit from 171 additional postgraduate seats approved by the NMC across various clinical specialties. Counselling authorities are directed to include these seats immediately for the 2025-26 academic year, following appeals by medical colleges against earlier decisions. This move aims to maximize seat utilization and provide more opportunities for aspiring doctors.

For SIR: UP man returns home from Bengal after 28 years; comes in search of documents
description: A man presumed dead for 28 years returned to his hometown in Muzaffarnagar to collect documents for West Bengal's electoral roll revision. Sharif Ahmed, who had moved to West Bengal after remarrying in 1997, reappeared to gather his father's death certificate and a domicile certificate. His return brought overwhelming emotion and disbelief to his relatives and locals.

description: Robert Pires, a key Arsenal winger during their modern era, earned significant income from his playing career and post-retirement media work. While his wife, Jessica Lemarie, contributes to their public profile, most net worth estimates heavily rely on Pires' documented earnings, placing their combined wealth between $12 to $20 million.

title: Four friends, including three women, killed in Kullu car crash after New Year-birthday party
description: Tragedy struck near Kullu as four young friends, returning from a New Year's Eve party, perished when their car collided with a roadside barrier and a parked truck. The victims, including three women, were just a kilometer from their homes. Preliminary investigations suggest the car was traveling at high speed.

description: The rules specify that a minimum of 70% of the District Mineral Trust Fund must be spent only on directly affected areas, and for high-priority sectors such as drinking water supply and health care

‘DMK handled State finances well despite Centre’s indifference’
BSF nabs Bangladeshi national near border; hands him over to police
description: A 19-year-old Bangladeshi national, Shariful Islam Bhuiyan, was apprehended by BSF near the international border in Jammu. He arrived in India on December 1, 2025, and claimed to be a tourist seeking a Portugal visa. Authorities are verifying his travel documents and digital devices.

title: J&K govt will discuss Kashmiri shawl sellers’ harassment with states concerned, says NC
description: National Conference expresses concern over alleged assaults on Kashmiri shawl sellers nationwide, with J&K government to address the issue with concerned state governments. The Union Home Ministry has taken note of the attacks, and the Jammu and Kashmir Students Association has urged the Home Minister for intervention.

title: Ladakh's new chief secy Ashish Kundra vows peace
description: New Ladakh Chief Secretary Ashish Kundra prioritizes addressing people's aspirations and preserving the Union territory's civilisational history of peace. He also voiced concerns over Ladakh's fragile ecology, cautioning against reckless development amid heightened demands for statehood and Sixth Schedule status.

title: Pakistan-based terror handler’s property attached in Poonch
description: Jammu and Kashmir Police have attached agricultural land worth Rs 10 lakh belonging to Pakistan-based terror handler Rafiq Nai. Nai, a launch commander for Tahreek-ul-Mujahideen / Jammu Kashmir Ghaznavi Force, is accused of supervising narcotics and weapons smuggling and facilitating terrorist infiltration. This action is part of a strategy to dismantle terror support networks.

title: Combing op in Poonch after drone drops ‘IED’ along LoC
description: Security forces launched a combing operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district after a drone reportedly dropped an IED and weapons. Searches by the Army, special operations group, and local police recovered a bag with ammunition rounds and a suspected IED in a tiffin box.

title: Meet Kim Knor, the 86-year-old ‘skydiving grandma’ with 1,000 jumps

description: India, ahead of the five-match  joust against New Zealand beginning later this month, are sitting on an unbeaten streak in T20Is stretching to 15 series; they are unequivocally the No. 1 side in the world and possess an array of riches capable of holding its own in any conditions

description: NHL trade buzz is intensifying as the Vancouver Canucks reportedly explore deals involving Kiefer Sherwood and Elias Pettersson. Meanwhile, the Boston Bruins are rumored to be eyeing Matias Maccelli to bolster their offense. With the March 6 trade deadline looming, these potential moves are capturing significant league attention, hinting at imminent roster changes for both franchises.

title: From encroachment to legal ownership
description: Haryana government regularises unauthorised occupation of village panchayat land through payment, aiming to reduce litigation and resolve disputes; this risks converting encroachment into ownership, stabilising gains for those with ability to pay while limiting access for marginalised households on village commons

title: How a viral video led Maharashtra Police to a kidney transplant racket
description: Maharashtra investigators allege illegal network involving two doctors with links to Cambodia; they say poor youth and marginalised farmers from the State sold kidneys for ₹5 lakh to ₹8 lakh

description: Kim praised his men fighting in an "alien land", congratulating their "heroic" defence of the nation's honour and instructing them to "be brave", the state-run Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) said Thursday.

While demonstrations have slowed in Tehran, they've expanded to rural provinces, with fatalities occurring in cities inhabited by the Lur ethnic group. The unrest, fueled by economic pressures, also includes chants against the theocratic system.

description: The incident took place around 9.30 pm in the Damudya area, near Keurbhanga Bazar in the Koneshwar Union. The victim, 50-year-old Khokon Chandra Das, was reportedly waylaid, beaten and doused with petrol before being set ablaze, reported news agency ANI, citing Prothom Alo. Das was later shifted to Dhaka for advanced treatment as his condition worsened, the report said.

This incident follows a meeting between US President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

title: IIT-Hyd student lands Rs 2.5 cr package; highest in institute’s history
description: A computer science engineering student from IIT Hyderabad has achieved a historic Rs 2.5 crore package from a Netherlands-based firm, marking the highest ever at the institution. This achievement comes amidst a challenging job market, with the student converting a two-month internship into a pre-placement offer. The institute also saw a significant 75% jump in average packages.

He highlighted Tesla's end-to-end neural network versus Waymo's modular system, which struggled during a San Francisco power outage. Karpathy praised the milestone despite recent criticism from Elon Musk about his "dated" views.

India, Pakistan exchange list of nuke sites: What is 1988 agreement? Explained
description: India and Pakistan have exchanged lists of their nuclear installations and facilities, marking the 35th consecutive annual update under a 1988 agreement. This routine exchange, continuing even during periods of tension, aims to prevent accidental or deliberate attacks on critical nuclear infrastructure, fostering predictability between the two nuclear-armed neighbours.

title: Fans hail Ayesha Curry’s 'A+ wife move' as gesture for Stephen Curry goes viral
description: Ayesha Curry recently garnered widespread praise from fans for wearing her husband Stephen Curry's Davidson jersey during a visit to his alma mater. This heartwarming gesture, seen during a tribute to the NBA star, effectively silenced recent marriage rumors. Fans lauded her unwavering support and loyalty, highlighting the couple's strong bond.

title: When Steve Jobs sent an 'angry email' to Adobe CEO Bruce Chizen; said: One of us must change our …
description: In 2005, Steve Jobs confronted Adobe CEO Bruce Chizen over alleged poaching of Apple employees. Jobs believed in a non-recruiting agreement, while Chizen proposed a senior-level exception. The exchange ultimately led to an agreement to avoid actively soliciting employees from either company.

title: TOI Survey On Consumer Behaviour: Fitness, OTT, and food top 2025 priorities; taste, comfort drive choices
description: Indians are prioritizing fitness, with visible results being key for many. Entertainment sees a surge in OTT consumption, while mindful scrolling increases. Financially, budgeting and goal-setting are paramount. Travel experiences are driven by relaxation and shareable aesthetics. Comfort food reigns supreme, with taste quality being the ultimate food experience driver.

title: Neuralink and parenting: Meta AI chief Alexandr Wang on kids; will wait until Neuralink advances
description: Meta's AI head, Alexandr Wang, revealed he will delay having children until advanced brain-computer interface (BCI) technology like Neuralink is widely available. Wang believes children's early neuroplasticity offers a prime window for intuitive BCI integration, potentially enabling future generations to learn and utilize superintelligence tools more effectively than adults.

title: Caitlin Clark & Connor McCaffery 2025 net worth: Earnings & endorsements
description: Caitlin Clark and Connor McCaffery, a power couple in the sports world, boast a combined net worth of $11.5 million. Clark, a WNBA star, has secured lucrative endorsements alongside her rookie contract. McCaffery, a rising basketball coach, is building his career after playing multiple sports in college. Their individual successes contribute to their impressive financial standing.

title: Happy New Year 2026: Over 70 wishes to share — images, quotes, status & more
description: As 2026 approaches, the article highlights the diverse ways people celebrate and express New Year's wishes. It emphasizes the value of simple, heartfelt messages, relatable quotes, and genuine status updates, alongside visual elements like images and wallpapers, to connect with loved ones during this transitional period.
